title: Visualize gratitude entries as growing plant/tree organisms per subject

requirements.text: Create an interactive plant/tree visualization view. Group all gratitude entries by their category/subject — each unique category becomes its own plant. Render each plant as an animated, growing tree or plant illustration using React Three Fiber (Three.js) or SVG-based 2D rendering. The plant starts as a seed when there is 1 entry, grows into a sprout with 2–3 entries, a sapling with 4–6 entries, and a full tree with 7+ entries. Each individual gratitude entry for a subject is represented as a branch or leaf on that plant. Display the subject/category label beneath each plant. Tapping or hovering a branch/leaf reveals the gratitude text for that entry in a tooltip or popover.

quotes: Make the gratitude as a seed and the more you water it hypothetically and it grows into a tree or plant the plant is the subject and each plant is a different subject and the branches are the gratitude that make that subject

acceptanceCriteria: Each unique category/subject from the stored entries is rendered as a separate plant/tree on screen.
A category with 1 entry shows a seed or seedling; 2–3 entries shows a sprout; 4–6 entries shows a sapling; 7+ entries shows a full tree.
Each gratitude entry for a subject is visually represented as a branch or leaf on its corresponding plant.
Hovering or tapping a branch/leaf displays the gratitude text for that entry.
The plant garden view updates reactively when entries are added or deleted.
Entries without a category are grouped under a default 'General' plant.
Plants are arranged in a horizontal scrollable or grid layout so multiple plants are visible at once.

requirements.text: Replace or supplement the existing flat gratitude list view (GratitudeList) with the new plant garden visualization as the primary display mode. The form (GratitudeForm) and stats bar (GratitudeStats) should remain accessible above the garden. The garden should be the hero visual experience of the app. Keep the existing list view accessible as a secondary 'List View' toggle if needed, but default the app to the garden/plant view.

quotes: the plant is the subject and each plant is a different subject and the branches are the gratitude that make that subject

acceptanceCriteria: On load, the app defaults to the plant garden visualization view.
A toggle or tab allows switching between the garden view and the traditional list view.
GratitudeForm and GratitudeStats remain visible and functional above the garden view.
The garden view fills the main content area with a warm, nature-inspired aesthetic consistent with the existing warm color theme.

requirements.text: Apply a nature-inspired visual style to the plant garden page. Use an earthy, warm background (e.g., soft soil or sky gradient), and style plants with organic shapes, warm greens, ambers, and browns consistent with the existing warm palette. Add a gentle idle sway animation to plants. When a new entry is added, trigger a brief 'watering' or 'growth' animation on the corresponding plant to show it growing.

quotes: the more you water it hypothetically and it grows into a tree or plant

acceptanceCriteria: The garden background uses an earthy warm gradient (sky, soil tones) consistent with the app's warm palette.
Plants gently sway in a looping idle animation.
When a gratitude entry is added to a subject, the corresponding plant plays a visible grow or 'watering' animation.
Plant colors and shapes feel organic and nature-inspired (greens, ambers, browns, leaf shapes).

constraints: Do not modify backend/main.mo — the existing addEntry, getEntries, and deleteEntry methods are sufficient.
Do not edit files under frontend/src/hooks/ (useActor.ts, useInternetIdentity.ts) or frontend/src/components/ui.
Reuse existing useGetEntries, useAddEntry, useDeleteEntry hooks from frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts for all data access.
Maintain the existing warm color theme defined in frontend/src/index.css and tailwind.config.js.
nonGoals: No new backend data models or API methods — plant grouping is purely a frontend concern derived from existing category fields.
No real-time multiplayer or shared gardens.
No gamification points, streaks, or reward systems beyond the visual plant growth metaphor.

required: Seed stage: a small round brown seed sitting in dark soil, warm minimal illustration style (plant-seed.dim_128x128.png)
Sprout stage: a tiny green sprout with two small leaves emerging from soil, warm earthy illustration style (plant-sprout.dim_128x128.png)
Sapling stage: a small leafy tree sapling with a thin trunk and several branches, warm greens and ambers, illustrated (plant-sapling.dim_200x256.png)
Full tree stage: a lush full tree with many rounded leaf clusters, warm sage greens and golden ambers, illustrated (plant-tree.dim_256x320.png)
Earthy garden ground/soil strip texture, wide horizontal banner for the garden floor (garden-ground.dim_1200x120.png)
Soft warm sky gradient background for the plant garden scene, light amber and cream tones (garden-sky.dim_1200x600.png)
